contentrichtext.text: {{Refimprove|date=December 2009}} {{Infobox South African town |censuscode = 41019 |name = Ventersburg |settlement_type = |image_skyline = Matjhabeng-Ventersburg-001.jpg |imagesize = |image_caption = The [[N1 road (South Africa)|N1 National Road]] passing through Ventersburg. |image_map = |mapsize = |map_caption = |image_map1 = |mapsize1 = |map_caption1 = |pushpin_map = |pushpin_label_position = |pushpin_map_caption = Location in the Free State |pushpin_mapsize = |subdivision_type = Country |subdivision_name = {{flag|South Africa}} |subdivision_type1 = [[Provinces of South Africa|Province]] |subdivision_name1 = [[Free State (South African province)|Free State]] |subdivision_type2 = |subdivision_name2 = |subdivision_type3 = |subdivision_name3 = |government_footnotes = |government_type = |leader_party = |leader_title = |leader_name = |established_title = |established_date = |area_total_km2 = |elevation_m = |population_as_of = |population_footnotes = |population_total = |population_density_km2 = |timezone=[[South Africa Standard Time|SAST]] |utc_offset=+2 |coordinates_display = display=inline,title |latd=28 |latm=5 |lats=|latNS=S |longd=27 |longm=8 |longs= |longEW=E |postal_code_type = Postal code |postal_code = 9450 |area_code = 057 651 |website = |footnotes = }} '''Ventersburg''' is a small town in the [[Lejweleputswa District Municipality]] of the [[Free State (South African province)|Free State]] province in [[South Africa]]. It was established on the farm Kromfontein which was owned by PA Venter who died in [[1857 in South Africa|1857]]. His son allowed a Reform Church to be established on the farm in [[1864 in South Africa|1864]] and by [[1871 in South Africa|1871]], the first plots of the original farm were sold. Ventersburg was declared on 6 May 1873. The Dutch Reform Church was built in Ventersburg in [[1891 in South Africa|1891]] but it was burnt down in [[1900 in South Africa|1900]] by the British forces during the [[Second Boer War|Boer War]]. The church was later re-built in [[1912 in South Africa|1912]]. Municipality was also burnt down by the British forces during the [[Second Boer War|Boer War]]. Is located 148.09 kilometers from Bloemfontein (Capital City of the Free State). In [[1903 in South Africa|1903]], Ventersburg became a municipality but on the 5 December 2000 it was incorporated into the [[Matjhabeng Local Municipality]] along with the city of [[Welkom]] and the towns of [[Allanridge]], [[Hennenman]], [[Odendaalsrus]], and [[Virginia, Free State|Virginia]]. During the [[apartheid]] era, black people were forced to live outside Ventersburg in the location of '''Mamahabane'''. The location has expanded into two districts, the second is Tswelangpele. ==References== {{reflist}} {{commons category}} [[Category:Populated places in the Lejweleputswa District Municipality]] [[Category:Populated places established in 1873]] {{FreeState-geo-stub}}
